topic.title: Authentication
topic.shortdesc: Authentication is a process that securely identifies who is accessing the system.

body.p: Authentication for Couchbase Server can be done either with a password (for administrators and applications) or with LDAP (for administrators).
In the following sections, password setup and authentication and LDAP authentication are desribed.
body.section:
Setting Up Passwords for Couchbase AdministratorsPasswords for the full administrators are set up during the initial installation of Couchbase Server. See Step 5: Configure Server for details.
Check also the Security Best Practices for setting Couchbase passwords.
